info.author: Christiaan Frans Rademan
info.description:
========
Neuron C
========

Proof of Concept Openflow Controller in Python

Project under early development.

**At this point not useable, many elements are missing.**

Functionality working::

    * Accept connections from Openflow TCP:6633 Connections.
    * Exchanges hello messages and detects Openflow version.
    * Responds to Echo Requests to keep connection open.
    * Only accept connections Manager Server TCP port 7777 (Possibly RESTAPI) 

Running Server
--------------

.. code:: bash

    $ neuronc_server settings.ini

**settings.ini** located in root of repo.

Installation
------------

Neuron C currently fully supports `CPython <https://www.python.org/downloads/>`__ 2.7.

Source Code
-----------

Neuron C infrastructure and code is hosted on `GitHub <https://github.com/vision1983/neuronc>`_.
Making the code easy to browse, download, fork, etc. Pull requests are always welcome!

Clone the project like this:

.. code:: bash

    $ git clone https://github.com/vision1983/neuronc.git

Once you have cloned the repo or downloaded a tarball from GitHub, you
can install Neuron C like this:

.. code:: bash

    $ cd neuronc
    $ pip install .

Or, if you want to edit the code, first fork the main repo, clone the fork
to your desktop, and then run the following to install it using symbolic
linking, so that when you change your code, the changes will be automagically
available to your app without having to reinstall the package:

.. code:: bash

    $ cd neuronc
    $ pip install -e .

You can manually test changes to the neuronc by switching to the
directory of the cloned repo:

.. code:: bash

    $ pip install -r requirements-dev.txt
    $ paver test
